newsitem.title: TAIWAN: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - October 21.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - Taiwan newspapers - October 21.

text.p: These are the leading stories in the Taiwan press on Monday. Reuter has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
CHINA TIMES - Liberal Democratic Party boosts parliamentary strength in Japan's general election.
Some 91 precent of government employees do not report property honestly as required.
UNITED DAILY NEWS - Ryutaro Hashimoto to continue as Japan's prime minister after Sunday's election.
Taiwan plans to allow foreign-owned mother vessels, in addition to feeder vessels, to sail between Taiwan and China after it allows direct links between two sides.
COMMERCIAL TIMES - Yoong Feng Yu Paper Corp buys 49 percent of Chung Hua Printing Co.
Japan's Liberal Democratic Party fails to win more than 50 percent of Lower House seats in Sunday's general election.
ECONOMIC DAILY NEWS - Foreign-owned mother vessels would be allowed to sail between Taiwan and China after direct shipping links between two sides go into effect.
Taiwan will start bilateral talks in Geneva with eight countries for entry to World Trade Organisation.
